questions.question: What is the primary goal of material balance in a process?

answers.c: To account for the quantities of materials entering and leaving a system

questions.question: A process involves the reaction of 100 kg of A with 200 kg of B to form 250 kg of C and 50 kg of D. What is the degree of freedom for this system?
What is the difference between a closed system and an open system in material balance?

answers.a: Closed system has no inputs or outputs, while open system has both
answers.b: Closed system has inputs but no outputs, while open system has both
answers.c: Closed system has outputs but no inputs, while open system has both
answers.d: Closed system has both inputs and outputs, while open system has neither

questions.question: A stream has a flow rate of 100 kg/h and a composition of 80% A and 20% B. What is the flow rate of A in kg/h?
What is the purpose of a tie component in material balance?

answers.a: To calculate the flow rate of a stream
answers.b: To calculate the composition of a stream
answers.c: To provide an additional equation to solve for unknowns
answers.d: To simplify the material balance equations

questions.question: A process involves the mixing of two streams, each with a flow rate of 50 kg/h. If the composition of one stream is 70% A and 30% B, and the other stream is 30% A and 70% B, what is the composition of the resulting stream?
What is the energy balance equation for a system with no reaction?
A process involves the heating of a stream from 20°C to 80°C. If the heat capacity of the stream is 2 kJ/kg°C, what is the energy required to heat 100 kg of the stream?
What is the difference between the internal energy (U) and enthalpy (H) of a system?

answers.a: U is a state function, while H is a path function
answers.b: U is a path function, while H is a state function
answers.c: U includes kinetic energy, while H includes potential energy
answers.d: U includes potential energy, while H includes kinetic energy
